list_definition.mean_english: tiền rút từ thẻ ghi nợ
list_definition.definition: cash which you can get from a shop when you pay for something with a debit card. The shop will give you the money which will be taken from your bank account

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I got £30 cashback from the supermarket.

list_definition.definition: an amount of money that is returned to someone if they buy something, especially if they accept certain conditions

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They’re offering £50 cashback on various tablet computers.

list_ex_of_english: Cashback is limited to 200 euros per day.
The retailer pays the cashback from the commission it receives from the network for referring a new customer.
The combination of these two factors means that the retailer can save money by offering the cashback service.
Cashback deals paid over time allow the retailer to provide an incentive on condition that the consumer sticks to the terms of the contract, thereby securing the retailers' commission.
Many cashback offers are based on a retailers' efforts to meet network targets, which will result in a bonus payment from the network alongside the usual commission.
The cashback website receives a commission from the retailer that, after the purchase is confirmed, is shared with the customer who made the purchase.
The toolbar is also designed to notify the user if the merchant they are visiting offers cashback rewards, and also highlight merchants that offer cashback in search engine result pages.
In the programs it provides, income from retail firms is passed to their employees in the form of discounts, rebates and cashback on other companies' products and services.
